topics.body:
"@Evident Disaster":/dis/the-time-wasting-thread/post/547e446463687202456f0000#post_547e446463687202456f0000
[bq="Evident Disaster"]I thought of something funny that may happen if Japan ever decides to build a Gundam, oh by the way they actually are, it's a three quarters of a billion dollars, but they're planning on making a real Gundam.
Back to the point, trying to build a small force of these 18m tall killing machines would prove rather challenging, the only issue is what do we do with them after they're made? 

18m tall machines kind of stand out in a battlefield so no way they'd be dumb enough to send them into a warzone.

They can't use them for land based heavy work cause their bodies weight tons as is and would likely crack holes wherever they stepped. 

So what do you use a titan sized machine for? [/bq]
Dude; no, just no.  A actual mech wouldn't be of any tactical use and would be about as bulletproof as paper because as machines get larger they require exponentially more energy to move.

Inb4 someone goes "what about aircraft carriers" and ignores that it's a boat.

A real life gundam able to fly and move that fast would require fusion energy or else it would be moving less than a tenth of a mile *A DAY*.

topics.body:
"@uc9":/dis/the-time-wasting-thread/post/547e50e16368727bddaf0100#post_547e50e16368727bddaf0100

Yeah the tech is possible Thorium power source, it uses nuclear residue from actual fission reactors to produce equivalent or higher level of power. Though it's still in development its theoretically possible to create smaller reactors from something like that. 

As for the machine itself we've got Carbon Nano-tubes man it's not going to be long before they figure out a lightweight design for armour with high density and hardness to use for such machinery. It's all theoretical though, it's a work in progress. 

Can't expect everything to work out right away. I mean they may take 5 or 15 years before such a thing is ready, you know they had a back up plan to just build a Zaku model next to the Gundam in Japan and then build the real thing later.

Let me put it another way:
A real life gundam would require so much power and generate so much heat that the heat alone would destroy a entire city.
topics.author: 38b55cdf63616403d7560600

topics.body:
Also I'm kind of in the process of making a new story, any of you guys hear of Article 2? You know the one with the human who's a real asshole instead of being all conforming. He's also hilarious, making tons of references, and a really great characterization. 

I wanted to try something similar, though with more characters, like a nerdy dude, the social ideologist, the grumpy jackass of a Sargent Major, and their Lieutenant who's a pretty chill guy, but he's no push over and he can kick a manticore's ass with a 40mm. 

All in all it's about 4 men and a whole lot of pony, and satire, and possibly political involvement and some other stuff, like the possibility of war and maybe Chaos, probably a lot more politics though. I really want to try my hand and a sociopolitical kind of story. Anyone else have that urge?
topics.author: 5046d66d7f123b38980018c6

topics.body:
"@uc9":/dis/the-time-wasting-thread/post/547e553c6368725c55b90000#post_547e553c6368725c55b90000
Actually I doubt that, I mean there are ways around such things, though I can't remember what form of technology is in development to overcome the heating issue, I'm sure they'll address that at a later point in time. 

I'm rather more interested in the possibility we'll get something like a stuff from Full Metal Panic ever developed or Patlabor, Gundam's can come later, I don't really mind. Also spaceships, spaceships make for good talk, and lasers, and rail guns, and nuclear fusion engines, which may or may not be developed in the next 50 years. Damn it.
